title.narrative: Somalia: Targeted country assistance
Somalie (la): Aide ciblée aux pays

description.narrative:
Plans d’assistance technique ciblée aux pays L’assistance technique ciblée aux pays (TCA) est octroyée sous forme de ressources destinées aux partenaires présents dans les pays. La TCA est un élément du cadre d’engagement avec les partenaires (PEF) de Gavi. Le plan de TCA d’un pays est établie selon les besoins exprimés du dit pays lors de l’évaluation conjointe. Un plan comprend une liste d’activités, d’étapes clés, et un budget pour une année dite. L’assistance technique est un soutien non financier fourni par des spécialistes. Elle peut revêtir plusieurs formes : partage d’information et de savoir-faire, formation et services-conseils.
L’assistance technique fournie dans le cadre du PEF est appelée aide ciblée aux pays. Ce type de soutien vise principalement à payer le personnel basé en permanence dans les bureaux pays des partenaires. Il repose sur la demande et les besoins identifiés par les pays eux-mêmes.

Targeted country assistance (TCA) are resources provided to in-country partners under Gavi’s partners’ engagement framework (PEF). A country’s TCA plan is based on needs expressed by the country during the joint appraisal discussions. It includes sets of activities, milestones and budget for a given year.Technical assistance is non-financial support provided by specialists. It can take the form of sharing information and expertise, training and consulting services.
The technical assistance provided through PEF is called targeted country assistance (TCA). This type of support mainly consists of staff permanently based in partners’ country offices. It is based on the demand and needs identified by the countries themselves.

condition.narrative: Conditions are detailed in the Partners’ engagement framework
Les conditions sont détaillées dans le cadre d'engagement des partenaires

title.narrative: UNICEF : Data

1.Re-train health workers and partners on the correct use of revised HMIS data collection and monitoring tools, data analysis, interpretation, and use, employing DHIS2 and Provide training on the use of revised manual stock management tools, forecasting, wastage, and calculations 2.Functional system for monitoring vaccine stock-out and wastage rates customized in DHIS2 to provide Situation analysis on vaccine stock-outs & wastages conducted, Monthly reporting of EPI data from hard-to-reach facilities through DHIS2, 3.Strengthen immunization defaulter mechanism through supply and use of SMS, tickler files and CHWs.

target.value: 1. HMIS Officer (NOB-TA) to build the capacity of regional and district HMIS Officers and health facility staff on HMIS/DHIS2 and support the transmission of EPI and health data from hard-to-reach areas using DHIS2.This will help to Identify, capture, synthesize, and share lessons learned for knowledge development and to build the capacity of stakeholders. 2. Re-train health workers and partners on the correct use of revised HMIS data collection and monitoring tools, data analysis, interpretation, and use, employing DHIS2 and Provide training on the use of revised manual stock management tools, forecasting, wastage, and calculations 3. Conduct regular programme field visits and surveys and share information with partners and stakeholders to assess progress and provide technical support and/or refer to relevant officials for resolution. Report on critical issues, bottlenecks, and potential problems for timely action to achieve results. 4. Strengthen immunization defaulter mechanism through supply and use of SMS, tickler files and CHWs. 5. Apply innovative approaches and promote good practices to support the implementation and delivery of concrete and sustainable programme results. Assist with oversight of research and ensure results are available for use in knowledge products. 6. Support and lead the DHIS2 Indicator review and the officer will install a system for monitoring vaccine stock-out, wastage rate and customize it in DHIS2

comment.narrative: - With technical support of UNICEF, the MoH conducted DHIS2 indicator review , the health facility data mapping is going on with all Health facilities with GPS. UNICEF has distributed the tablets that are primed with DHIS2 electronic version so that the pilot hard to reach Health facilities can report on the DHIS2. Training of District Managements teams on DHIS2 data entry was conducted. - UNICEF were able to inbuild the LMIS within DHIS2 during the review of indicators which will help in improving reporting, forecasting, wastage and calculation of stock as Health facilities will be reporting directly in the DHIS2. - UNICEF has conducted EPI review meeting across the States in which we reviewed the progress, discussed challenges and lessons learnt of the EPI program. we also follow of EPI data and addressing some issues related to the quality of EPI data. - Defaulter tracing has been roll out in targeted 40 districts in CSR, the defaulter tracing training has been conducted, in addition, we are using social mobilisers and ticklers files as result the dropout rate is gradually decreasing. - UNICEF supported the MoH to customize the LMIS within DHIS2 for stock managements and control of wastage rate.

title.narrative: 1.HMIS Officer (NOB-TA) to build the capacity of regional and district HMIS Officers and health facility staff on HMIS/DHIS2 and support the transmission of EPI and health data from hard-to-reach areas using DHIS2.This will help to Identify, capture, synthesize, and share lessons learned for knowledge development and to build the capacity of stakeholders. 2. Support and lead the DHIS2 Indicator review and the officer will install a system for monitoring vaccine stock-out, wastage rate and customize it in DHIS2 3. Strengthen immunization defaulter mechanism through supply and use of SMS, tickler files and CHWs. 4. Conduct regular programme field visits and share information with partners and stakeholders to assess progress and provide technical support progress and provide technical support

target.value: 1. HMIS Officer (NOB-TA) to build the capacity of regional and district HMIS Officers and health facility staff on HMIS/DHIS2 and support the transmission of EPI and health data from hard-to-reach areas using DHIS2.This will help to Identify, capture, synthesize, and share lessons learned for knowledge development and to build the capacity of stakeholders. 2. Re-train health workers and partners on the correct use of revised HMIS data collection and monitoring tools, data analysis, interpretation, and use, employing DHIS2 and Provide training on the use of revised manual stock management tools, forecasting, wastage, and calculations 3. Conduct regular programme field visits and surveys and share information with partners and stakeholders to assess progress and provide technical support and/or refer to relevant officials for resolution. Report on critical issues, bottlenecks, and potential problems for timely action to achieve results. 4. Strengthen immunization defaulter mechanism through supply and use of SMS, tickler files and CHWs. 5. Apply innovative approaches and promote good practices to support the implementation and delivery of concrete and sustainable programme results. Assist with oversight of research and ensure results are available for use in knowledge products. 6. Support and lead the DHIS2 Indicator review and the officer will install a system for monitoring vaccine stock-out, wastage rate and customize it in DHIS2

comment.narrative: UNICEF supported the training of 103 health workers in Puntland on data quality improvement at facility level. Training in other states is pending the finalization of the HMIS revision. HMIS officer conducted field visits to contribute to the improvement of the reporting system. UNICEF provided technical support for the development of the defaulter tracing mechanism across the Country. This include the use of social mobilisers to trace the defaulters, phone calls made by the health workers and the use of tickler boxes. HMIS officer was at the fore front in supporting the MoH to revise the DHIS2.

title.narrative: UNICEF : Supply chain
95% of cold chain staff trained on cold chain and vaccine management

target.value: Capacity building and skills transfer in cold chain and vaccine management

comment.narrative: 100% of cold chain staff were trained on cold chain and vaccine management. Cold chain technicians were also trained on the repair and maintenance of CCE. In addition, UNICEF and the MoH capitalised on the trainings to build the capacity of health workers (vaccinators) on vaccine managment.

title.narrative: 80% of cold chain staff trained on cold chain and vaccine management especially on new vaccines

target.value: Capacity building and skills transfer in cold chain and vaccine management

comment.narrative: Cold chain technicians, managers of vaccine stores and health workers in SL, PL and FMS received capacity building on cold chain repair and maintenance of the new CCE procured through CCEOP support, as well as the existing CCE. Currently, the staff is supporting the country in developing of the CCE transition plan with the eventual objective of transitioning management of cold chain management services from NGOs to the MoH in the FMS.

title.narrative: Covax, MCV2, nOPV2, IPV 2nd dose vaccines distributed as per deployment plan in 100% of the targeted districts

target.value: Support any outbreak response plan and support the introduction of new vaccines i.e. Covax, MCV2, IPV 2nd doses, nOPV2

comment.narrative: Technical support was provided to respond to cDPV2 outbreak in Southern States and measles outbreak in Kismayo and Baidoa districts. mOPV2 was distributed and reverse logistic done. Measles vaccines and injectable devises were distributed to respond to the measles outbreak. Technical support was also provided in the development of the NDVP, vaccine application, capacity building, development of various tools and guidelines, COVID-19 vaccination roll out, resource mobilization and review of the achievements, challenges and lessons learnt. Support is ongoing for the introduction of MCV2, nOPV2 and IPV2.

title.narrative: 2022 national vaccine forecast developed jointly by the MoH and UNICEF

target.value: Monitor and support the distribution of EPI supplies and vaccine forecasting

comment.narrative: The annual forecast for 2022 has been completed and submitted to the UNICEF Supply Division. UNICEF provided technical support in the development of this forecast, including responding to comments from the Supply Division.

title.narrative: Over 90% of cold chain equipment functional

target.value: Periodically update the cold chain equipment inventory

comment.narrative: The cold chain equipment is updated quarterly and shared among the EPI stakeholders. Quarterly corrective and preventive maintenance was also conducted by the cold chain technicians. 93% of the CCE are functioning in the country.

title.narrative: Annual cold chain inventory updated

target.value: Periodically update the cold chain equipment inventory

comment.narrative: The cold chain inventory was updated on a quarterly basis, the inventory included the recently installed CCEOP1 equipment. The WHO sizing tool was used to analyze the inventory to support the Country in developing the CCEOP COVAX application.

title.narrative: Outbreak response plans made available and new vaccines introduced in RI system

target.value: Support any outbreak response plan and support the introduction of new vaccines i.e. Covax, MCV2, IPV 2nd doses, nOPV2

comment.narrative: UNICEF provided critical technical support at a most important moment for the country following the outbreak of the COVID-19 pandemic. Technical support was provided in the development of the initial NDVP and a revised version of the NDVP, application for vaccines, development of numerous proposals to mobilise funding to support the operational costs of rolling out of the COVID-19 vaccination. UNICEF was also at the forefront in developing the capacity of the country in the management of COVID-19 vaccines, providing cold chain & logistics support, developing various strategies and engaging various stakeholders, including communities through various mediums to create demand for COVID-19 vaccines. The demand aspect also looked at promptly identifying and addressing issues of refusals and hesitancy that were reported. It is through these efforts that have contributed to commendable uptake of COVID-19 vaccines in the country, in spite of a very challenging operational & security environment. As of 7th November 2021, a total of 654,862 doses of COVID vaccines had been administered, of whom 291,760 were fully vaccinated and 363,102 were partially vaccinated. This represents 4.2% per 100 persons. So far, the country has received 1,061,600 doses and is deploying AZ, J&J and Sinopharm. UNICEF also provided technical support in the development of proposals for the introduction of MVC2 and IPV2. These proposals were approved and vaccines are already in the country, ready for introduction from November 2021. The detailed introduction plan, including building the capacity of health & community workers as well as cold chain staff have been developed and trainings completed. Funding for this introduction has already been received in the country. The country also successfully applied for the introduction of nOPV2 and capacity buildings sessions for various health workers have been done. Unfortunately, due to global scarcity of nOPV2, the introduction was pushed to 2022.

title.narrative:
EVMA consultant on board
CCEOP-2 cold chain equipment in country and final ODP shared

target.value:
TA to support GAVI HSS project planning, implementation, monitoring and evaluation of the UNICEF component across Somalia.
Support the implementation of the Effective Vaccine Management Assessment (EVMA)
Provide technical support for immunization and cold chain management in Somalia. Monitor and give technical support on the implementation of the CCEOP-2 project.

comment.narrative: UNICEF provided technical support for the implementation and monitoring of the cold chain and vaccine supply & logistics component of the Gavi HSS support to Somalia. This include timely forecasting, storage and distribution of RI vaccines, monitor the functionality of the cold chain, capacity building, coordination with MoH and NGO partners. In addition, CCEOP1 was successfully implemented where 296 new SDD CCE were installed across the country. 78 SDD CCE procured using the HSS2 additional funds were also installed. The CCEOP2 application was also approved by the Gavi IRC and the Country will benefit from an additional 235 SDD CCE. Using the COVAX facility support, the Country submitted an application for additional 37 SDD CCE. The CCEOP support will greatly expend the cold chain storage capacity and reduce the operational costs, thus contribute to increased vaccination coverage and sustainability of the cold chain in Somalia.

title.narrative:
EVMA conducted and a new costed EVM improvement plan developed
CCE under CCEOP-2 fully installed.

target.value:
TA to support GAVI HSS project planning, implementation, monitoring and evaluation of the UNICEF component across Somalia.
Support the implementation of the Effective Vaccine Management Assessment (EVMA)
Provide technical support for immunization and cold chain management in Somalia. Monitor and give technical support on the implementation of the CCEOP-2 project.

comment.narrative: UNICEF provided technical support in the implementation of cold chain and vaccine management activities in the country. This includes support to routine immunisation, supplementary immunisation activities and COVID-19 vaccination. In terms of the 2017 EVM Implementation Plan , the country successfully installed 374 SDD CCE benefiting 347 health facilities. These equipment were procured through CCEOP-1 and also funding from the Gavi Fragility Policy (additional funds) In addition, the country is expecting to receive 235 solar fridges under CCEOP-2 and 34 SDD under the COVAX CCEOP. CCEOP-2and the COVAX CCEOP will greatly boost the storage capacity at the district level by equipping the district stores with SDD and health facilities that are still using electric fridges. The ODPs for CCEOP-2 and the COVAX CCEOP have been developed and and approved, procurement process completed and the equipment is expected to arrive into the country before end November 2021 and equipment under CCEOP-2 is expected in late December 2021. For the EVMA planned for 2021, the plan is complete, but unfortunately there is no funding to support it. The country has submitted a budget to Gavi to support the EVMA.

title.narrative: Routine immunisation vaccines distributed quarterly as per distribution plan and the 2021 vaccine forecast prepared and submitted

target.value: Monitor and support the distribution of EPI supplies and vaccine forecasting

comment.narrative: UNICEF supported the Country in developing and submission of the 2021 National vaccine and EPI supplies forecasting which was submitted to the UNICEF Supply Division. UNICEF monitored and followed on the supply of vaccines from the Supply Division to the National vaccine store. In the Country, the Cold Chain Specialist worked hand in hand with the UNICEF field office colleagues and the Ministries of Health to ensure timely forecasting and distribution of vaccines from the National Vaccine store to the cold chain hubs in Mogadishu, Garowe and Hargeisa respectively. In the last 6 months, challenges were encountered in obtaining customs clearance from the Kenyan Authorities and tax exemption from the Somali Authorities. This led to the occasional delay in delivering vaccines from the Central vaccine store in Nairobi.

title.narrative: UNICEF : Health Information Systems (Data)
Capacity of regional and district HMIS officer strengthened, Monitoring of vaccine stock-out fully foctional through DHIS2

target.value: HMIS Officer (NOB-TA) to build the capacity of regional and district HMIS Officers and health facility staff on HMIS/DHIS2 and support the transmission of EPI and health data from hard-to-reach areas using DHIS2. The officer will in future install a system for monitoring vaccine stock-out, wastage rate and customize it in DHIS2

comment.narrative: A HMIS Officer was recruited to support the country in improving the capacity of MoH HMIS Officers. The Officer is supporting the country in revising the DHIS2 and the related data collection tools. During the recent Gavi MSD, it was discussed that the transmission of data from remote health facilities may be re-programmed.

target.value: HMIS Officer (NOB-TA) to build the capacity of regional and district HMIS Officers and health facility staff on HMIS/DHIS2 and support the transmission of EPI and health data from hard-to-reach areas using DHIS2. The officer will in future install a system for monitoring vaccine stock-out, wastage rate and customize it in DHIS2

comment.narrative: A HMIS Officer was recruited to support the country in improving the capacity of MoH HMIS Officers. The Officer is supporting the country in revising the DHIS2 and the related data collection tools. During the recent Gavi MSD, it was discussed that the transmission of data from remote health facilities may be re-programmed.

title.narrative: WHO : Programme Management - LMC
Urban immunization stretagy implemented in Mogadishu, 33 health fcailities providing RI services through fixed and outreach sessions

target.value: P4 and 2 NOB to support the MoH in the development of the EPI annual work plan, implementation of routine immunization activities including strategies and approaches to reach margnilized populations, also support MoH in implementation of urban immunization stretagy in Mogadishu

comment.narrative: All 33 health facilities in 9 districts of Mogadishu are providing vaccination at fixed and outreach sites

target.value: P4 and 2 NOB to support the MoH in the development of the EPI annual work plan, implementation of routine immunization activities including strategies and approaches to reach margnilized populations, also support MoH in implementation of urban immunization stretagy in Mogadishu

comment.narrative: All 33 health facilities in 9 districts of Mogadishu are providing vaccination at fixed and outreach sites

title.narrative: WHO
67 health facilities ( supported under HSS additional funds) microplans developed as per RED approach

target.value: P4 and 2 NOB to support the MoH in the development of the EPI annual work plan, implementation of routine immunization activities including strategies and approaches to reach margnilized populations, also support MoH in implementation of urban immunization stretagy in Mogadishu

comment.narrative: Annual workplans developed by the team at state and federal level

title.narrative: Potential Private health service providers identified.

target.value: Using the findings of the 'Assessing the capacity of the private health system in Somalia' done by Oxford Policy Management (OPM) contracted by GF/UNICEF, potential private sector health service providers will be identified to find out right engagement strategy for immunization service delivery.

comment.narrative: Private hospitals are engaged in provision of routine immunization services and also COVID 19 vaccination.

title.narrative: Comprehensive plan developed by engaging all stakeholders.

target.value: Development of new cMYP for next cycle.

comment.narrative: cMYP developed

title.narrative: WHO : Programme Implementation/Coverage & Equity
65% of activities of DQIP implemented

target.value: Support implemantation of data quality improvement plan and polio transition plan

comment.narrative: Due to COVID 19 pandemic there are delay in implementation of DQIP

target.value: Support implemantation of data quality improvement plan and polio transition plan

comment.narrative: Due to COVID 19 pandemic there are delay in implementation of DQIP

target.value: Support implemantation of data quality improvement plan and polio transition plan

comment.narrative: More than 90% of DQIP activities are completed, polio transition is in the progress.

title.narrative: Timeliness and completeness of reporting improved by 20%

target.value: 2 new NOB Staff recruited under PEF 2020 will provide support in strengthening integrated surveillance system including lab component, especially measles case based surveillance

comment.narrative: Surveillance has improved including timeliness and completeness of reports

target.value: 2 new NOB Staff recruited under PEF 2020 will provide support in strengthening integrated surveillance system including lab component, especially measles case based surveillance

comment.narrative: Surveillance has improved including timeliness and completeness of reports

title.narrative: WHO : Data
Data Improvement Plan (DIP) implemented

target.value: To Support at national level based in Mogadishu, this position will support MOH in data analysis and management. He will also provide monthly immunization analysis to all states to provide support for timely actions to understand where we are missing children. he will also ensure rggular screening and cleaning of data.

comment.narrative: Data quality improvement plan implemented in all states including Hirshebblle, SW state, Jubaland, Galmadug, Banadir Administration, Puntland and Somaliland. There were some delays because of COVID 19 pandemic but now all the activities are on track.

title.narrative: New specific VPD surveillance system implemented or integrated

target.value: To provide support to MOH ( Galmadug and Hargisa) in strengthening integrated surveillance system including lab component, especially measles case based surveillance. Support MOH in data analysis of routine immunization, support MoH in introduction of electronic registration, recording and reporting tool for COVID 19 vaccination

comment.narrative: Federal and all state ministries are supported in data analysis of routine EPI, new electronic recording and reporting toll has been introduced in the country and it is being utilized. It provides real time data. VPD surveillance is part of IDSRS and also EWARN system. IDSRS is being finalized by the country

title.narrative: Data improvement field activity implemented (review, validation, monitoring, harmonisation, mentorship, workshop, others)

target.value: To provide support to MOH ( Galmadug and Hargisa) in strengthening integrated surveillance system including lab component, especially measles case based surveillance. Support MOH in data analysis of routine immunization, support MoH in introduction of electronic registration, recording and reporting tool for COVID 19 vaccination

comment.narrative: RI data is regularly analyzed and findings are shared with recommended actions. Surveillance system is also improving including lab component.

title.narrative: Data desk review or triangulation analysis performed (coverage, surveillance, operational, others)

target.value: To Support at national level based in Mogadishu, this position will support MOH in data analysis and management. He will also provide monthly immunization analysis to all states to provide support for timely actions to understand where we are missing children. he will also ensure rggular screening and cleaning of data.

comment.narrative: Routine immunization data is regularly analyzed and feedback is shared with states and regions. Data is regularly shared with all stakeholders and also used for resource mobilization.

title.narrative: WHO : Financial/General Management
Accounting/financial management system delivered and operational

target.value: To improve program financial management

comment.narrative: Recruitment is under process

target.value: To improve program financial management

comment.narrative: Recruitment process completed and person is on board. Financial management/reporting has improved. most of the activities are supported through DI mechanisms.

target.value: To improve program financial management

comment.narrative: Staff is on board, recruitment process has been completed.

title.narrative: UNICEF : Vaccine-Specific Support
Outbreak response plans made available and new vaccines introduced in RI system

target.value: Support any outbreak response plan and support the introduction of MCV2 and switch from TT to Td

comment.narrative: Staff supported integrated polio, measles campaign with no major vaccine management challenges reported. Staff also supported polio campaigns (mOPV2 and bOPV). The countrysuccessfully switched from TT to Td and the staff greatly supported the switch. Supported MCV2 and IPV2 proposal development and introduction is planned for 2021. Currently, staff is providing support for the COVAX introduction. Staff also supported the country in the recent Gavi MSD and in developing the EPI recovery plan. Staff supported the country in successfully developing the CCEOP-2 application that was approved by Gavi.

target.value: Support any outbreak response plan and support the introduction of MCV2 and switch from TT to Td

comment.narrative: Staff supported integrated polio, measles campaign with no major vaccine management challenges reported. Staff also supported polio campaigns (mOPV2 and bOPV). The countrysuccessfully switched from TT to Td and the staff greatly supported the switch. Supported MCV2 and IPV2 proposal development and introduction is planned for 2021. Currently, staff is providing support for the COVAX introduction. Staff also supported the country in the recent Gavi MSD and in developing the EPI recovery plan. Staff supported the country in successfully developing the CCEOP-2 application that was approved by Gavi.

title.narrative: UNICEF : Supply Chain & Procurement
95% of cold chain staff trained on cold chain and vaccine management

target.value: Capacity building and skills transfer in cold chain and vaccine management

comment.narrative: Capacity building sessions on vaccine management were conducted in Q1-2021. The beneficiaries of this training included Health Workers and Cold Chain staff. Similarly, Cold Chain technicians were trained on repair and maintenance of cold chain equipment. At the National level, the Cold Chain Specialist transferred vaccine forecasting skills to the MOH EPI Cold Chain Manager. Additionally, the Cold Chain Specialist transferred vaccine management skills to the UNICEF cold chain consultants, who in turn transferred the skills to the MOH Reginal cold chain Managers.

target.value: Capacity building and skills transfer in cold chain and vaccine management

comment.narrative: Capacity building sessions on vaccine management were conducted in Q1-2021. The beneficiaries of this training included Health Workers and Cold Chain staff. Similarly, Cold Chain technicians were trained on repair and maintenance of cold chain equipment. At the National level, the Cold Chain Specialist transferred vaccine forecasting skills to the MOH EPI Cold Chain Manager. Additionally, the Cold Chain Specialist transferred vaccine management skills to the UNICEF cold chain consultants, who in turn transferred the skills to the MOH Reginal cold chain Managers.

title.narrative: 2022 national vaccine forecast developed jointly by the MoH and UNICEF

target.value: Monitor and support the distribution of EPI supplies and vaccine forecasting

comment.narrative: Staff supported the development of the 2021 national vaccine forecasting. Staff also ensured that all vaccines forecasted in 2020 arrived in-country and were distributed as planned. The staff also supported the zonal offices in the management of vaccines & EPI supplies through MoH and the NGO managing cold chain throughout the country.

target.value: Monitor and support the distribution of EPI supplies and vaccine forecasting

comment.narrative: Staff supported the development of the 2021 national vaccine forecasting. Staff also ensured that all vaccines forecasted in 2020 arrived in-country and were distributed as planned. The staff also supported the zonal offices in the management of vaccines & EPI supplies through MoH and the NGO managing cold chain throughout the country.

title.narrative: 90% of cold chain equipment functional

target.value: Periodically update the cold chain equipment inventory

comment.narrative: Staff supported the updating of the CCE inventory on a quarterly basis. It is based on this inventory that a gap analysis was developed and used in the CCEOP-2 proposal development, that was submitted and approved by Gavi. Additionally, the inventory was used in the COVAX introduction and proposal development.

target.value: Periodically update the cold chain equipment inventory

comment.narrative: Staff supported the updating of the CCE inventory on a quarterly basis. It is based on this inventory that a gap analysis was developed and used in the CCEOP-2 proposal development, that was submitted and approved by Gavi. Additionally, the inventory was used in the COVAX introduction and proposal development.

title.narrative:
EVMA conducted and a new costed EVM improvement plan developed
CCE gap analysis completed in 3 zones

target.value:
Support the implementation of the EVM improvement plan
Provide technical support for immunization and cold chain management in Somalia. Monitor and give technical support on the implementation of the CCEOP project

comment.narrative: The EVM implementation plan is on track, 68% of activities have been completed, 29% are in progress and 4% still pending. The CCEOP-1 implementation is in progress, with 99% of the equipment installed across the country (SL - 100%, FMS - 97% and PL - 100%). 78 additional pieces of CCE were procured recently through the additional funds and distribution and installation is on-going.

target.value:
Support the implementation of the EVM improvement plan
Provide technical support for immunization and cold chain management in Somalia. Monitor and give technical support on the implementation of the CCEOP project

comment.narrative: The EVM implementation plan is on track, 68% of activities have been completed, 29% are in progress and 4% still pending. The CCEOP-1 implementation is in progress, with 99% of the equipment installed across the country (SL - 100%, FMS - 97% and PL - 100%). 78 additional pieces of CCE were procured recently through the additional funds and distribution and installation is on-going.

title.narrative: UNICEF : Service Delivery
19 Priority districts develop micro-plans and integrated EPI/Nutrition outreaches & mobile services are provided by NGO/CSO partners

target.value: HSS/NOB staff in SCZ to support identification and reaching missed & zero dose children living in 19 priority districts of the FMS through outreach and mobile strategies. The staff will support the priority districts in developing integrated EPI micro-plans (including cold chain & demand generation) and that community leaders are closely invlolved in the development of these micro-plans. To coordinate and monthly monitoring of activities implemented by NGOs/CSOs providing integrated EPI and nutrition services in the priority districts of the FMS. This will ensure that marginalised communities are reached with critical life-saving PHC interventions. To also support the MoH in the introduction of new vaccines; MCV2, nOPV2 and fIPV.

comment.narrative: The Federal and State MOH annual EPI work plans were developed, and implementation is ongoing. EPI and nutrition activities are integrated as part of the PHC package of services. There will be scale up of integrated EPI and Nutrition services in outreach and for marginalized populations ( nomads) in additional districts from July, 2021. Weekly and ad hoc coordination meetings with the Federal and State Ministries of Health were conducted in the last semester. Some of the priorities discussed include: Measles outbreak investigation and response, COVID-19 vaccination roll out, Routine Immunization and vaccine supply and logistics and new vaccine introduction ( MCV2, IPV2 , nOPV2 and fIPV). TT to Td switch was completed in all districts.

title.narrative: 100% of the priority districts are implementing integrated EPI/Nutrition outreaches. nOPV2 is introduced for polio outbreak management in the FMS

target.value: HSS/NOB staff in SCZ to support identification and reaching missed & zero dose children living in 19 priority districts of the FMS through outreach and mobile strategies. The staff will support the priority districts in developing integrated EPI micro-plans (including cold chain & demand generation) and that community leaders are closely invlolved in the development of these micro-plans. To coordinate and monthly monitoring of activities implemented by NGOs/CSOs providing integrated EPI and nutrition services in the priority districts of the FMS. This will ensure that marginalised communities are reached with critical life-saving PHC interventions. To also support the MoH in the introduction of new vaccines; MCV2, nOPV2 and fIPV.

comment.narrative: The NOB staff provided technical support in supporting the MoH to identify the districts that carry the heaviest burden of zero-dose and under-vaccinated children. He also actively participated in the identification and the selection process of NGOs/CSOs that are implementing the integrated outreach and mobile vaccination strategies. The provision of the integrated services has ensured that vulnerable children are reached with lie-saving EPI and nutrition services that include; Vitamin A supplementation, screening for malnutrition, deworming, referral of complicated cases, defaulter tracing, community sensitisation and the provision of all antigens during the integrated outreaches and mobile sessions. The staff also provided technical support in the planning, trainings and introduction of IPV2, MCV2 and piloting fIPV2 in priority districts. Due to global scarcity of nOPV2, the was pushed to 2022.

title.narrative: 29 prirority districts implementing integrated EPI/Nutrition services in fixed, outreach and mobile strategies and zero-dose as well as under-vaccinated children reached in the priority districts and urban areas. EPI recovery plan is implemented (if financed).

target.value: Provide technical assistance in the implementation of the urban immunization strategy in 2 priority districts and support the implementation of the integrated EPI/Nutrition programme in 29 priority districts through MoH and NGO/CSOs. Emphasis will be reaching zero dose and missed children identified in the 2 urban areas and also identifying and reaching missed children living in rural and remote communities. Also to support the implementation and monitoring of on-going HSS2 programme in 14 districts across Somalia. Also to support the MoH and UNICEF Field Offices in scaling-up defaulter tracing mechanisms to reduce drop-outs. Also work closely with MoH and WHO to develop an EPI recovery plan to reach children missed and under-vaccinated children in most-affected districts following the impact/effect of COVID-19.

comment.narrative: The urban immunisation strategy has achieved palpable progress in reaching zero-dose and under vaccinated children living in urban slums, IDP camps and peri-urban areas of Hargeisa and Bossaso towns. For example, in Hargeisa there were 8,583 zero-dose children in 2019 and 11,014 zero-dose children in 2020. The situation in 2020 was worsened by the impact of COVID-19 on EPI. However, with the implementation of the urban immunisation strategy from Jan 2021, the district was able to reach and vaccinate all target children, i.e. no zero-dose children by June 2021. UNICEF provided technical support in orienting the MoH in the use of the toolkit for urban immunisation strategy that defines the 5 key strategic areas geared towards improving coverage and equity in urban areas. Community and the local leadership was closely involved in the planning, implementation and monitoring of the programme during the quarterly reviews. In Bossaso, the MoH used GIS mapping to identify maldistribution of health facilities and used the opportunity to address this so as to ensure equity in the provision of EPI services in Bossaso. 25 priority districts are implementing integrated EPI and nutrition services during outreaches and mobile vaccination sites targeting nomads and missed communities. UNICEF supported the country to develop and implement a defaulter tracing mechanism that consist of making phone calls by the health workers to the caregivers, use of tickler files and use of social mobilisers/community workers to identify children who have defaulted. UNICEF also spearheaded the development of a costed recovery plan for the EPI programme to mitigate the adverse effects of COVID-19 on EPI. This plan as shared to stakeholders during the January MSD and an updated version was developed and shared in the latter part of the year and submitted to the FMoH. The updated recovery plan looked at supporting poorly performing districts due to various reasons, but also to build on HSS2 gains.

title.narrative: UNICEF
Decommissioning guidelines and maintenance plan developed

target.value: Development of cold chain equipment decommissioning guidelines (for obsolete cold chain equipment) and development of a comprehensive cold chain equipment maintenance plan

comment.narrative: The ToR of the consultant were developed. The ToR were reviewed to amalgamate decommissioning of CCE guidelines and waste management. However, due to COVID-19 outbreak and the CO return to office strategy, it will not feasible to bring in an international consultant at the moment and plans are in place to have the consultant in-country in Q4-2021.

title.narrative: UNICEF : Programme Implementation/Coverage & Equity
MCV2 and Td vaccines are fully introduced in all districts in the FMS and immunization services are integrated with Nutrition and WASH activities.

target.value: HSS/NOB staff in SCZ to support the MoH in the development of the EPI annual work plan, implementation of routine immunization activities including strategies and approaches to reach margnilized populations and ensure integration of immunization with other saving live programmes. Support the coordination of immunization activities. Support the introduction of MCV2 and the switch from TT to Td

comment.narrative: Staff supported MoH in development of EPI and emergency workplan and also implementation of these plans to improve coverage. He also supported the implementation of integrated programmes during the measles & polio campaigns and integrating EPI into the nutrition programme (OTP). He also successfully supported the switch from TT to Td and the development of the MCV2 proposal in line with the country's 5 year measles elimination strategy. In cold chain, he supported the implementation of CCEOP-1 and the management of cold chain services through NGOs.

target.value: HSS/NOB staff in SCZ to support the MoH in the development of the EPI annual work plan, implementation of routine immunization activities including strategies and approaches to reach margnilized populations and ensure integration of immunization with other saving live programmes. Support the coordination of immunization activities. Support the introduction of MCV2 and the switch from TT to Td

comment.narrative: Staff supported MoH in development of EPI and emergency workplan and also implementation of these plans to improve coverage. He also supported the implementation of integrated programmes during the measles & polio campaigns and integrating EPI into the nutrition programme (OTP). He also successfully supported the switch from TT to Td and the development of the MCV2 proposal in line with the country's 5 year measles elimination strategy. In cold chain, he supported the implementation of CCEOP-1 and the management of cold chain services through NGOs.

title.narrative: Fully Implementation of routine activities through fixed, outreach and Mobile services including integration of EPI program with Nutrition activities using all OTP sites in SL, PL and FMS.

target.value:
TA to support GAVI HSS project planning, implementation, monitoring and evaluation of the UNICEF component across Somalia.
The staff will include a review of feasibility and key potential challenges for integration and suggest realistic recommendations.

comment.narrative: The staff supported implementation of routine immunisaiton in the Gavi-supported as well as non-Gavi supported districts. He supported the MoH to develop integration strategies between EPI and nutrition programmes that has already begun to be implemented in Puntland and will be scaled to the other areas of the country from Q1/2021. He also supported the integrated measles & polio campaigns. He also supported MCV2/IPV2 proposal development, COVAX introduction, development of the routine immunisation recovery plan, COVID-19 response. Also monitored implementation of year 3 HSS2 activities, planning of year 4 HSS2 activities and activities supported by Gavi additional funds. Supported the country in the recent Gavi MSD, donor reporting and DQIP implementation.

target.value:
TA to support GAVI HSS project planning, implementation, monitoring and evaluation of the UNICEF component across Somalia.
The staff will include a review of feasibility and key potential challenges for integration and suggest realistic recommendations.

comment.narrative: The staff supported implementation of routine immunisaiton in the Gavi-supported as well as non-Gavi supported districts. He supported the MoH to develop integration strategies between EPI and nutrition programmes that has already begun to be implemented in Puntland and will be scaled to the other areas of the country from Q1/2021. He also supported the integrated measles & polio campaigns. He also supported MCV2/IPV2 proposal development, COVAX introduction, development of the routine immunisation recovery plan, COVID-19 response. Also monitored implementation of year 3 HSS2 activities, planning of year 4 HSS2 activities and activities supported by Gavi additional funds. Supported the country in the recent Gavi MSD, donor reporting and DQIP implementation.

title.narrative: UNICEF : Demand Promotion & ACSM
Penta 1/Penta 3 drop-out rate is decreased from 8% to 4%.

target.value: Support the implementation of the social mobilisation activities which align with the micro-plans in the 25 supported districts. Ensure C4D microplanning/mapping of communities as well as local and religious influencers and development of district communication plans to maximise the impact of the planned C4D activities including for cross-border areas.

comment.narrative: Community mobilisation and sensitisation were carried out by the community mobilisers in the 25 districts, who are part of the polio eradication initiative. The routine immunisation programme is leveraging on their knowledge of the communities and the vaccination programme to raise awareness and demand for routine immunisation services as part of the polio transition strategy. Information, Education, and Communication (IEC) materials were utilised in these community sessions to disseminate the key messages. Radio spots were also disseminated advocating for routine immunisation. Religious, community leaders, nomadic leaders and women groups were actively involved in conducting community sensitisation meetings across the 25 districts. Mosques made regular announcements on routine immunization and women groups were sensitised on the importance of vaccination and the tracing of defaulters. DSMCs supported the health workers in tracing defaulters in the target districts. Since March 2020, the community mobilisers supported the COVID-19 response by conducting social mobilisation activities in their respective communities. Data collection of the COVID 19 Rapid Assessment completed

target.value: Support the implementation of the social mobilisation activities which align with the micro-plans in the 25 supported districts. Ensure C4D microplanning/mapping of communities as well as local and religious influencers and development of district communication plans to maximise the impact of the planned C4D activities including for cross-border areas.

comment.narrative: Community mobilisation and sensitisation were carried out by the community mobilisers in the 25 districts, who are part of the polio eradication initiative. The routine immunisation programme is leveraging on their knowledge of the communities and the vaccination programme to raise awareness and demand for routine immunisation services as part of the polio transition strategy. Information, Education, and Communication (IEC) materials were utilised in these community sessions to disseminate the key messages. Radio spots were also disseminated advocating for routine immunisation. Religious, community leaders, nomadic leaders and women groups were actively involved in conducting community sensitisation meetings across the 25 districts. Mosques made regular announcements on routine immunization and women groups were sensitised on the importance of vaccination and the tracing of defaulters. DSMCs supported the health workers in tracing defaulters in the target districts. Since March 2020, the community mobilisers supported the COVID-19 response by conducting social mobilisation activities in their respective communities. Data collection of the COVID 19 Rapid Assessment completed

title.narrative: Lessons learnt are used to inform the 2021 demand creation strategies of the Ministry of Health

target.value: Support training of health care providers in focused districts in FMS, Somaliland & Puntland on C4D methods to reinforce the capacity of collecting and using social data to design and implement effective C4D interventions including social mobilization and IPC.

comment.narrative: Following the resumption of SIAs after the outbreak of COVID-19, RSMCs, DSMCs and health workers across the country received one session of orientation on social mobilisation strategies and stimulating demand for routine immunisation services.

target.value: Support training of health care providers in focused districts in FMS, Somaliland & Puntland on C4D methods to reinforce the capacity of collecting and using social data to design and implement effective C4D interventions including social mobilization and IPC.

comment.narrative: Following the resumption of SIAs after the outbreak of COVID-19, RSMCs, DSMCs and health workers across the country received one session of orientation on social mobilisation strategies and stimulating demand for routine immunisation services.

title.narrative: HCD trainings implemented in FMS, Puntland and Somaliland

target.value: Conduct human centered training at 3 locations in FMS, Somaliland and Puntland to support development and implementation of Urban Immunization Strategy.

comment.narrative: Human centred design trainings were conducted in Somaliland, Puntland and the FMS with the technical lead from the C4D Specialist. These trainings were crucial in improving the capacity of health workers in terms of improving demand for EPI services.

title.narrative: Social mobilization implemented in the 43 supported districts

target.value: Support the implementation of the social mobilisation activities which align with the micro-plans in the 43 supported districts.

comment.narrative: Social mobilisation activities were conducted in the 43 priority districts in line with the micro-plans and the HSS2 workplans. These activities included social mobilisation through community mobilisers, engagement with women groups, engagement with key influencers at all levels, advocacy through multi-media channels (including social media) and traditional drama sessions. Engagement with key influencers for vulnerable groups such as nomadic elders and gate keepers in IDPs camps was also conducted.

title.narrative: Evidence based SBCC to inform maternal and new-born child health and Urban Immunization Strategies are developed

target.value: C4D Specialist P3 - TA to support the development and implementation of evidence based interventions to ensure demand and uptake of immunization are adequetely and timely supported in FMS, Puntland and Somaliland.

comment.narrative: The C4D Specialist played a very critical role in guiding the UNICEF Field Offices and the MoH on the human-centred design whose aim was to improve the understanding of health workers on the needs and perceptions of the community towards healthcare givers. Through trainings that were conducted in Hargeisa, Bossaso and Mogadishu, the capacity of the health workers (including IPC skills) to address community needs was improved, greatly contributing to the phenomenal success of the urban immunisation strategy in Bossaso and Hargeisa towns. The engagement with key influencers and community leaders was also improved, further contributing to the palpable results of the urban immunisation strategy. The C4D Specialist also played a pivotal role in the leading numerous assessments related to the COVID-19 pandemic so as to deepen the undertadning of the health system to the perception & rumours that curtailed health seeking behaviours during the pandmic. Through this understanding, strategies were developed and messages were disseminated through different channels, including through key influencers, so as to mitigate the negative impactive of COVID-19 on the EPI programme. She also played an important role in developing the demand generation component of the NDVP for COVID-19 vaccination and spearheading demand generation activities related to COVID-19 vaccination in the country.

title.narrative: Maternal and new-born child health strategy for demand creation, including routine immunisation utilised in 100% of districts

target.value: Conduct an operational research to understand social norms and behaviours affecting access to routine immunisation. This will assess the social norms and behaviours of different target groups, that influence access to routine immunisation and factors contributing to the low utilisation of services.

comment.narrative: In the midst of the pandemic, the country conducted a number of operational research to gain better understanding on the misinformation and misconceptions related to COVID-19 vaccination, thereby supporting the development of evidence-based & tailored strategies to address these misconceptions and misinformation. These operational researches have a correlation with routine immunisation services as the knowledge gained will be replicated in the routine immunisation programme. Faced by the introduction of a new vaccine targeting a new cohort and the lack of sufficient information, the country prioritised carrying out these operational research. To build the capacity of local institutions, the operational researches were conducted together with local institutions such as local consulting firms and universities.

target.value: Conduct an operational research to understand social norms and behaviours affecting access to routine immunisation. This will assess the social norms and behaviours of different target groups, that influence access to routine immunisation and factors contributing to the low utilisation of services.

comment.narrative: The activity was delayed due to the outbreak of COVID-19 but will be conducted in 2021. Due to restrictions imposed by COVID, this activity will now be conducted in conjuction with local Somali institutions with the technical support of UNICEF.

target.value: Conduct an operational research to understand social norms and behaviours affecting access to routine immunisation. This will assess the social norms and behaviours of different target groups, that influence access to routine immunisation and factors contributing to the low utilisation of services.

comment.narrative: The activity was delayed due to the outbreak of COVID-19 but will be conducted in 2021. Due to restrictions imposed by COVID, this activity will now be conducted in conjuction with local Somali institutions with the technical support of UNICEF.

title.narrative: Revised maternal and new-born child health strategy for demand creation, including routine immunisation developed

target.value: Conduct an operational research to understand social norms and behaviours affecting access to routine immunisation. This will assess the social norms and behaviours of different target groups, that influence access to routine immunisation and factors contributing to the low utilisation of services.

comment.narrative: The activity was delayed due to the outbreak of COVID-19 but will be conducted in 2021. Due to restrictions imposed by COVID, this activity will now be conducted in conjuction with local Somali institutions with the technical support of UNICEF.

title.narrative:
Urban demand creation strategy developed informed by the outcome of the human-centered research conducted in Mogadishu.
SMS reminder system in place at the community level contributing to the reduction of Penta1/Penta3 drop-out rate

target.value: Recruitment of C4D Specialist P3 - TA to gather and synthesise data for the generation of additional social evidence to inform the development of priority demand creation interventions e.g. mobile platforms / SMS reminders) to increase coverage for new HSS support. To also support the development of a communication plan for VPD emergencies.

comment.narrative: The recruitment of a C4D Specialist was completed. A KAP study on EPI/COVID-19 in collaboration with Bossaso University has commenced to gather evidence to inform demand generation strategies following the outbreak of COVID-19. A communication plan for VPD was developed.

target.value: Recruitment of C4D Specialist P3 - TA to gather and synthesise data for the generation of additional social evidence to inform the development of priority demand creation interventions e.g. mobile platforms / SMS reminders) to increase coverage for new HSS support. To also support the development of a communication plan for VPD emergencies.

comment.narrative: The recruitment of a C4D Specialist was completed. A KAP study on EPI/COVID-19 in collaboration with Bossaso University has commenced to gather evidence to inform demand generation strategies following the outbreak of COVID-19. A communication plan for VPD was developed.

title.narrative: C4D trainings implemented in 43 priority districts

target.value: Support training of Social Mobilization Coordinators (SOMNET) in focused districts in FMS, Somaliland & Puntland on C4D methods including social and behavioural change interventions, community engagement, monitoring and supervision, data collection and use.

comment.narrative: Trainings on social mobilisation and IPC skills to health workers were carried out across the country to improve the communication skills of health and community workers.

title.narrative: WHO : Leadership, management, and coordination (LMC)
Systems in place to track fund utilisation at all levels and corrective measures undertaken

target.value: To support FMoH & all state ministeries in implementation of DQIP, COVID 19 vaccination rollout and in introduction of new vaccine including IPV2, MCV2 and fIPV .Support PL MoH in improving routine immunization and Mass campaigns implementation.

comment.narrative: FMOH and state ministries are supported in implementation of DQIP, COVID 19 vaccines rollout, introduction of MCV2, IPV2 and fIPV. Puntland, Somaliland and Banadir administration were also supported in implementation of integrated campaign. Most of the activities are supported by DI practices.

title.narrative: EPI reviews and Joint Appraisals are well managed ensuring availability of relevant data to track progress

target.value: To support MOH for urban immunization implementation in Mogadishu. Support Banadir administration in introduction of MCV2, IPV2, fIPV, COVID 19 vaccination

comment.narrative: Urban immunization strategy being implemented in Mogadishu by supporting Banadir adminsitration and FMOH. WHO staff also supported Banadir administration in introduction of new vaccine i.e fIPV, MCV2, IPV2 and COVID 19 vaccines. EPI reviews and JAs were done virtually where possible due to COVID restrictions and recently some physical EPI review meeting conducted in Mogadishu and PL and SL in 2nd quarter of 2021.

title.narrative: Annual workplan and budgets include interventions to reach zero dose children

target.value: To support FMoH & all state ministeries in implementation of DQIP, COVID 19 vaccination rollout and in introduction of new vaccine including IPV2, MCV2 and fIPV .Support PL MoH in improving routine immunization and Mass campaigns implementation.

comment.narrative: Support is being provided to MoH puntland and federal ministry of health in improving routine immunization and also during campaign implementation.

target.value: To support MOH for urban immunization implementation in Mogadishu. Support Banadir administration in introduction of MCV2, IPV2, fIPV, COVID 19 vaccination

comment.narrative: Urban immunization strategy is being implemented in 9 districts of Mogadishu. COVID 19 vaccination introduced and preparations are ongoing for MCV2 and IPV 2 introduction.
